thread.title_full: Theresa May visits victims of the London terror attack in hospital

author: tmeyjes
title: Theresa May visits victims of the London terror attack in hospital
text:
Paramedics and medical staff were praised for their action after the attack (Picture: AFP/Getty Images) Prime Minister Theresa May has visited victims of the Westminster terror attack in hospital. 
Some 29 people were injured in the terror attack on Parliament yesterday, and seven of them, believed to include two police officers, are in a critical condition.
Family of murdered Pc Keith Palmer pay tribute to 'wonderful dad and husband' Many of the injured were taken to St Thomas’ Hospital immediately after the attack yesterday with doctors and nurses seen rushing out to help those who were injured.
NHS staff were praised for rushing from their hospital wards to help those wounded in the attack on Parliament and the car ploughing into pedestrians on Westminster Bridge.
Images from the scene show eddoctors, nurses and paramedics running into the road on Westminster Bridge where more than a dozen pedestrians were mown down by a car.
Theresa May has visited the injured victims of the terror attack in hospital (Picture: PA Wire) Amongst the injured were three French school children and tourists including five South Koreans.
MORE: What you should do if you’re caught up in a terror attack 
MORE: London attacker named as Khalid Masood
